page.title: 04 HARLEY
page.content: In the village of Harley, the crossroads are situated at the centre and houses are scattered along the roads. Some of the houses have been built recently but some are very old. Many are quite large, showing a degree of affluence. It is certainly a village for people who enjoy the countryside and who can afford to buy houses. The gardens and houses are well looked after. From the village is an excellent view of Wenlock edge. The church of St. Mary's is situated on the high point of Harley. Small farms are in the area and also the village school, now closed. Young children, therefore,have to travel to school in Cressage by bus or car. There is no pre-school provision in Harley, older children attend the school in Much Wenlock or Ludlow.
